meanings.definition: To obtain by deception or trickery.
meanings.sent1: She tried to fenagles her way into getting extra dessert.
meanings.sent2: He always fenagles his little sister into sharing her toys.
meanings.sent3: The clever fox fenagles the chickens out of their eggs.
meanings.sent4: The con artist fenagles money from unsuspecting victims.
meanings.sent5: The magician fenagles a rabbit out of his hat.

meanings.definition: To manipulate or maneuver in a sly or underhanded way.
meanings.sent1: The spy fenagles his way through the enemy's defenses.
meanings.sent2: She always fenagles her schedule to avoid difficult tasks.
meanings.sent3: The raccoon fenagles the lid off the trash can to get to the food.
meanings.sent4: The politician fenagles support from influential donors.
meanings.sent5: The cat fenagles its way into a cozy spot by the fireplace.
